intro: Hieracium umbelliferum subsp. comocymosum, commonly known as the clustered hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant features upright, hairy stems and basal leaves that are typically lance-shaped. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in a compact, clustered inflorescence, giving it its common name. It thrives in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and roadsides.
